name: International Relations in the Middle East - Regional Perspectives on the 20th Century
description: The discovery of oil, the establishment of the state of Israel and subsequent wars for Palestine, Pan-Arabism and Political Islam were the over-riding factors in the regional balance of power. This course examines international relations as they were shaped by state- and non-state actors in 20th Century Egypt, Saudi Arabia, Israel/Palestine, Iraq, Iran, Lebanon and Syria. [24L]
prerequisites: HIS101H5, HIS201H5/ HIS236H5/ HIS282H5/ HIS290H5/ HIS295H5/ HIS306H5
